definition[0]: if your stomach churns, you feel sick because you are nervous or frightened
example[0]: My stomach was churning on the day of the exam.
definition[1]: if water, mud etc churns, or if something churns it, it moves about violently
definition[2]: if a machine, engine, wheel etc churns, it or its parts begin to move
example[2]: I pressed the gas pedal, and slowly the wheels began to churn.
definition[3]: to make milk by using a churn
definition[4]: a container used for shaking milk in order to make it into butter
definition[5]: a large metal container used to carry milk in
definition[6]: the number of people who stop buying or using a companyâ€™s products or services during a particular period
definition[7]: the number of customers who stop buying a service from a supplier in a particular period of time, either because they stop using the service or because they change to another supplier
example[3]: ISP churn rates average 4% to 8% a month.
